snippet: The attack, around noon, prompted the closing of schools, shops and streets, and the man’s body lay on the street outside the station on the Rue de la Goutte d’Or.
abstract: Man wielding knife is killed by French police officers after attempting to attack Paris police station; officers warned assailant, who wore fake suicide vest and shouted 'Allahu Akbar,' to stop before opening fire; authorities are unclear whether man, who professed allegiance to Islamic State, was mentally unstable and acting alone.

byline.original: By AURELIEN BREEDEN and ANNA POLONYI
byline.contributor: Hannah Olivennes contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: The attack, around noon, prompted the closing of schools, shops and streets, and the man’s body lay on the street outside the station on the Rue de la Goutte d’Or.

headline.main: Man With Fake Explosives Killed in Paris on Charlie Hebdo Anniversary
headline.print_headline: Armed Man in Fake Suicide Vest Is Killed by Paris Police
